allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
docs: Complete performance analysis with Quick Win validation

Comprehensive performance testing validates QW-4 memory stability 
(bounded with negative growth). Other metrics below expectations but
framework remains competitive with Unity''s reflection patterns.

Key Changes:
- Add PERFORMANCE_REPORT.md with full analysis
- Add Performance Characteristics section to CLAUDE.md
- Archive all graphs, CSV data to Documentation/Performance/
- Archive dev task to dev/archive/

Results Summary:
- Frame time: 32-36ms (28-31 FPS) - below target, requires optimization
- Memory: Negative growth validates QW-4 CircularBuffer
- Mercury vs SendMessage: 2.6x slower (acceptable)
- Mercury vs Control: 28x slower (expected for decoupling)

Files:
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/CLAUDE.md (Performance section added)
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Documentation/Performance/* (new)
- dev/archive/performance-analysis/* (archived task)
EOF
)")
Bash(for dir in spatial-indexing parallel-dispatch network-prediction parallel-fsm standard-library static-analysis thread-safety)

Bash(git -C "C:\Users\yangb\Research\MercuryMessaging" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
refactor(asmdef): Remove dead dependencies for zero-dep Core

Phase 0A of networking implementation complete:

- Remove 7 unused dependencies from MercuryMessaging.asmdef:
  Unity.XR.Interaction.Toolkit, Unity.InputSystem, Unity.Mathematics,
  NewGraph, NewGraph.Editor, ALINE, EPO
- Create MercuryMessaging.Examples.asmdef for tutorial files that
  require XR Toolkit and InputSystem
- Archive network-performance (292h) and network-prediction (400h)
  tasks into consolidated networking/ folder
- Add networking task documentation and session handoff

This enables open-source adoption with minimal dependencies.
EOF
)")

Bash(git -C "C:\Users\yangb\Research\MercuryMessaging" commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
feat(network): Add networking foundation infrastructure

Phase 0B of networking implementation - provider-agnostic backend layer:

Core Interfaces:
- IMmNetworkBackend: Transport abstraction for FishNet, Fusion, PUN2
- IMmGameObjectResolver: Maps network IDs to GameObjects per backend

Implementation:
- MmBinarySerializer: Efficient binary message serialization (15-byte header)
- MmNetworkBridge: Central orchestrator for network communication
- MmLoopbackBackend: Testing backend with immediate message echo
- MmRegistryResolver: Simple dictionary-based ID resolution
- Pun2Backend: PUN2 wrapper implementing IMmNetworkBackend

Supporting Changes:
- MmLogger: Add LogNetwork and LogWarning methods
- MmMessageGameObject: Add GameObjectNetId field for network serialization
- MmBinarySerializerTests: Unit tests for all message types

This enables backend-agnostic networking where FishNet, Fusion 2,
and PUN2 can all use the same messaging infrastructure.
EOF
)")
Bash(git -C "C:\Users\yangb\Research\MercuryMessaging" commit -m "docs: Update networking task docs for Phase 0A/0B completion")
